Punishments are handled in a 4-tier system:

1.) 10 game chat restriction
2.) 25 game chat restriction
3.) 14 day ban
4.) Permanent ban

The way it works is whenever you receive a punishment, you go up one tier, regardless of how minor the offense may have been, though it is possible to skip the chat restrictions and go straight to a 14 day/permanent ban if Riot deems the behavior severe enough. This means that whatever can get you a chat restriction can also get you a permanent ban, if you do it frequently enough.

With all that said, it's more of a question of "do these chat logs deserve a punishment" rather than "do these chat logs deserve a permanent ban." You mentioned that you had recently gotten off of your 14 day ban, so a permanent ban is standard for your next punishment, so now we need to decide if these logs are punishment worthy. 

I will admit, this isn't all that bad, but having received a 14 day ban recently meant that you were on very thin ice. There are a few things that stand out to me.

> mesmorize: sona ur the real troll on this team u 12 year kid
mesmorize: ur a such a baby
mesmorize: i would say more but i dont wanna get banned
mesmorize: so ill msg u after the game
mesmorize: dont worry
mesmorize: 12 year old

Calling Sona a troll, baby, and 12 year old kid here doesn't really help. It's negative and unnecessary, and really just makes the whole situation worse. Now, when it comes to your punishment, what others are doing doesn't matter. All that matters is your behavior because that is what you are being judged on. If others are breaking the rules, that doesn't mean that you can without consequence. If the Sona was trolling, that sucks, it really does, however harassing and insulting the player doesn't help the situation. You are allowed to politely suggest that they go to the bot lane, but if they don't comply, then there's really not much that you can do as you can't directly control their actions.

Also, you're threatening to message them after the game to harass them some more. While that's not what you said, there is a heavy implication that that is what you mean.

Calling others troll some more. On top of that, you're also calling for reports against the Sona. If you think someone is breaking the rules and you want to report them, that's fine, go ahead. However, calling for reports against another player is considered harassment, and can very well lead to a punishment.

There are a few reasons for this, but the biggest one, imo, is that it's completely unnecessary to do so. The system doesn't go by the number of individual reports a player receives. It goes by the percentage of games they are reported in, and it only takes a single report to flag a game. Any additional reports are pretty much unnecessary and don't do anything extra.

So, if you want to report someone, it's best to do so yourself and do so silently. Your report alone is enough to flag a game.

Overall, a decent amount of your chat is you arguing with your teammates. I'd say that this is punishable.

oh yeah? and banning me is helping that case? because last I checked only the people that are defending themselves are being reported and not the trolls themselves. And you wanna know why? because riot doesn't check gameplay to see if theyre actually trolling or not

**You cannot get punished unless you were in clear violation of the Terms & Service when reported**. 
Claiming "defense" does not magically make you free of any punishment. You are 100% responsible for your own behavior, regardless of circumstance. If you choose to act toxic towards your team, then you will get punished. You already clearly demonstrated you do not want to change your behavior considering you already went through the tier system of punishments without changing your attitude. 

People do not get false punishment or bans. And contrary to your belief, trolls do get punished and Riot **does check gameplay when cases of griefing and/or trolling are reported, as well as many other factors in the game to accurately asses the situation**. 

You can't dump the blame on Riot or anyone else, you got yourself banned so you need to own up to it. There is no "he started it" excuse. You chose to type all that out, only _you_ could have written that and pressed Enter. 

Nothing you do or say on the boards will lift your ban. The most anyone can do is give you advice on how to not fall into this situation again if you make a new account. But if you refuse to take the advice given to you (as you've already shown) then there's nothing left for you. 

So good luck.

> because last I checked only the people that are defending themselves are being reported and not the trolls themselves. 

If you're not reporting the trolls in your game that's your problem, I'm pretty sure most people do.

"Defending yourself" is using the mute button. It's a perfect defense, but you choose to not use it early enough or frequently enough. What were you trying to "defend", your honor? You *shamed* yourself by replying in kind. You lost it all because you didn't learn after your 10-game chat restriction, nor your 25-game chat restriction, nor your 2-week ban.

Whether or not they deserve it, harassing them back will not solve anything, but rather just make the whole situation worse. By harassing them back, you are simply lowering yourself to their level, and now the rest of your team not only has to deal with the troll, but you as well. I'm sure that a large majority of people wouldn't want you engaging with the troll, because it takes away from your time and focus on actually playing the game.

Now, if you want to defend yourself in chat, that's fine so long as you do so in a neutral or positive manner. If you are unable to do that, then it's best to mute the other player(s) and report them if you feel it necessary.
